01187 
01188 /**
01189  * Open and parse out the data of a file.
01190  * @param fileName - Name of PGF file to be opened.
01191  * @param xSize - How many features in x dimension.
01192  * @param ySize - How many features in y dimension.
01193  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Vector of probe set ids to be loaded.
01194  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01195  * @param chipType - What sort of chip should this pgf file be for?
01196  * @return bool - true if successful.
01197  */
01198 bool ChipLayout::openPgf(const std::string& fileName,
01199                          unsigned int xSize, unsigned int ySize,
01200                          const std::set<const char *, 
01201                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01202                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01203                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01204                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01205                          const std::string &chipType,
01206                          probeidmap_t &killList,
01207                          bool justStats, 
01208                          bool doPList)
01209 {
01210   // this was a member var (m_Pgf), now it is just a var.
01211   affx::PgfFile pgf;
01212   pgf.close();
01213 
01214   int rc = pgf.open(fileName);
01215   if (rc != TSV_OK) {
01216     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::openPgf() - Couldn't open pgf file: '" + fileName + "'");
01217   }
01218 
01219   if (!killList.empty())
01220     m_haveKillList = true;
01221 
01222   // Check that we match one of the chip_types in the file.
01223   /// @todo  move this into PgfFile.h
01224   bool chipTypeOk = false;
01225   std::string tmpChipType;
01226 
01227   pgf.m_tsv.headersBegin();
01228   if (chipType!="") {
01229     while ((!chipTypeOk)&&
01230            (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type",tmpChipType)==TSV_OK)) {
01231       if (tmpChipType==chipType) {
01232         chipTypeOk=true;
01233       }
01234     }
01235     if (!chipTypeOk) {
01236       Err::errAbort("In file '" + ToStr(fileName) + "' does not support chip type: " + chipType);
01237       return false;
01238     }
01239   }
01240 
01241   // Copy the header values to the layout.
01242   // it will use them while printing.
01243   std::string key;
01244   std::string val;
01245   pgf.m_tsv.headersBegin();
01246   while (pgf.m_tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
01247     if (key == "probeset_count") {
01248       m_ProbeCounts.reserve(Convert::toInt(val.c_str()));
01249     }
01250     m_Header[key].push_back(val);
01251   }
01252   setDimensions(xSize,ySize);
01253   // do the actual data suck
01254   unsigned int numProbes = m_XCount * m_YCount;
01255   //  if (doPList)
01256   if (m_SpfFileName != "") {
01257     openSpfForWrite(m_SpfFile,m_SpfFileName);
01258   }
01259   readProbeListPgfFileKillList(pgf, numProbes, m_PlFactory, probeSetsToLoad,
01260                                probesetNames, probesetDisplayNames, probeSubset, killList, justStats);
01261   pgf.close();
01262   if (!justStats)
01263     makePsMaps();
01264   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(getProbeSetCount()) + " probe sets.");
01265   if (m_SpfFile.is_open())
01266     m_SpfFile.close();
01267   return true;
01268 }
01269 
01270 /**
01271  * Read the contents of rowFile into a vector of
01272  * probe sets.
01273  * @param pgf - Opened Pgf file to read from
01274  * @param numProbes - How many probes are on this chip?
01275  * @param psVec - vector to be filled in.
01276  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Vector of probe set ids to be loaded.
01277  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01278  * @param killList - List of probes not to be used.
01279  */
01280 void ChipLayout::readProbeListPgfFileKillList(affx::PgfFile &pgf,
01281                                               unsigned int numProbes,
01282                                               //std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &plVec,
01283                                               ProbeListFactory &plFactory,
01284                                               const std::set<const char *, 
01285                                               Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01286                                               std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01287                                               std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01288                                               std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01289                                               probeidmap_t &killList,
01290                                               bool justStats) {
01291   bool probeSetsToLoad_empty=probeSetsToLoad.empty();
01292   set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::const_iterator probeSetsToLoad_iter;
01293   bool keepProbeSet;
01294 
01295   // If probeset count is set, us it to display progress info
01296   int expectedProbesets = -1;
01297   pgf.m_tsv.getHeader("probesets",expectedProbesets);
01298 
01299   string val;
01300   if (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("probesets",val)==TSV_OK){
01301     expectedProbesets = Convert::toInt(val.c_str());
01302   }
01303 
01304   // skip to the start of the data
01305   pgf.rewind();
01306   // m_PmProbes is a bitmask of which probes are PM.  (pm=true)
01307   resizeStats(numProbes);
01308 
01309   // Set up some local static storage. Once a probeset is determined
01310   // to be kept we will allocate memory on the heap for it. Trying to
01311   // prevent lots of new and deletes as they can fragement memory.
01312   ProbeSet psConst;
01313   int psConstMaxName = 256;
01314   psConst.name = new char[psConstMaxName];
01315   psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // null terminate.
01316   vector<Atom> *locAtoms = new vector<Atom>(MAX_ATOMS);
01317   vector<Probe> *locProbes = new vector<Probe>(MAX_PROBES);
01318   // gobble up probesets
01319   string tempName;
01320   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
01321   if (expectedProbesets > 0)
01322     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
01323   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0;
01324   while (pgf.next_probeset()==TSV_OK) {
01325     if (expectedProbesets > 0)
01326       Verbose::progressStep(1);
01327     seenProbesets++;
01328     //clearProbeSet(psConst); // redundant.
01329     int pmProbeCount = 0;
01330     int pmProbePossible = 0;
01331     clearProbeSet(psConst);
01332 
01333     // it is always this (for now I guess -jhg)
01334     psConst.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
01335 
01336     // copy the data over
01337         tempName = ToStr(pgf.probeset_id);
01338     if (tempName.size() + 1 >= psConstMaxName) {
01339       delete[] psConst.name;
01340       psConst.name = new char[tempName.size() + 1];
01341       psConstMaxName = tempName.size() + 1;
01342       psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // make sure always null terminated
01343     }
01344     strncpy(psConst.name, tempName.c_str(), psConstMaxName -1);
01345 
01346     // do we want to keep this probeset?
01347     keepProbeSet=true; // yes unless...
01348     if (!probeSetsToLoad_empty) {
01349       probeSetsToLoad_iter=probeSetsToLoad.find(psConst.name);
01350       if (probeSetsToLoad_iter==probeSetsToLoad.end()) {
01351         keepProbeSet=false;
01352       }
01353     }
01354     set<probeid_t> probesSeen;
01355     set<atomid_t> atomsSeen;
01356     set<probeid_t>::iterator seenIter;
01357 
01358     int locAtomIndex = 0;
01359     int locProbeIndex = 0;
01360     while (pgf.next_atom()==TSV_OK) {
01361       bool lastPmDropped = false;
01362       int atomProbeIndex = locProbeIndex;
01363       if (locAtomIndex + 1 > locAtoms->size()) {
01364         Verbose::out(2, "Resizing atom size from: " + ToStr(locAtoms->size()) + " to " + ToStr(locAtoms->size() + MAX_ATOMS));
01365         resizeAtoms(&locAtoms, locAtoms->size() + MAX_ATOMS, &psConst);
01366       }
01367       Atom *atom = &(*locAtoms)[locAtomIndex++];
01368       // copy over data
01369       atom->id = pgf.atom_id;
01370       // check to make sure we haven't seen this atom in this probeset before...
01371       if (atomsSeen.find(atom->id) != atomsSeen.end())
01372         Err::errAbort("Duplicate atom ids (" + ToStr(atom->id) + ") in probeset : " + ToStr(psConst.name));
01373       else
01374         atomsSeen.insert(atom->id);
01375       while (pgf.next_probe()==TSV_OK) {
01376         probeidmap_t::iterator iter;
01377 
01378         // If current probes are greater than local storage have to increase.
01379         if (locProbeIndex + 1 > locProbes->size()) {
01380           Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm/mm size from: " + ToStr(locProbes->size()) + " to " +
01381                        ToStr(locProbes->size() + MAX_PROBES));
01382           resizeProbes(&locProbes, locProbes->size() + MAX_PROBES, locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
01383         }
01384         Probe *probe = &(*locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
01385         // copy over data
01386         probe->id=pgf.probe_id;
01387         // check to make sure we haven't seen this probe in this probeset before...
01388         if (probesSeen.find(probe->id) != probesSeen.end())
01389           Err::errAbort("Duplicate probe ids (" + ToStr(probe->id) + ") in probeset : " + ToStr(psConst.name));
01390         else
01391           probesSeen.insert(probe->id);
01392         probe->type=Probe::typeForString(pgf.probe_type.c_str());
01393         if (pgf.gc_count >= NULLPROBEGC) {
01394           Verbose::out(1,"GC count, " + ToStr(pgf.gc_count) + ", exceeds software limit of " + ToStr(NULLPROBEGC - 1) + ". Ignoring.");
01395           probe->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01396         } else if (pgf.gc_count == -1) {
01397           probe->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01398         } else {
01399           probe->gcCount = (char)pgf.gc_count;
01400         }
01401         probe->id--; // Alan created pgf files 1-based, we want zero based.
01402 
01403         if (Probe::isPm(*probe))
01404           pmProbePossible++;
01405 
01406         if (inKillList((probeid_t)probe->id+1, psConst.name, killList)) {
01407           Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(probe->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(psConst.name) + " due to kill list");
01408           if (Probe::isPm(*probe)) {
01409             lastPmDropped = true;
01410           }
01411           clearProbe(*probe);
01412           locProbeIndex--;
01413         }
01414         // Did we exclude this probe's matching PM last time?
01415         else if (lastPmDropped && Probe::isMm(*probe)) {
01416           Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring MM probe " + ToStr(probe->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(psConst.name) + " due to PM in kill list");
01417           clearProbe(*probe);
01418           locProbeIndex--;
01419           lastPmDropped = false;
01420         }
01421         // treat it like a normal probe.
01422         else {
01423           // if this probeset contains a probe to be kept
01424           // make sure to keep the probeset around
01425           if (probe->type == Probe::PMAT || probe->type == Probe::PMST) {
01426             pmProbeCount++;
01427           }
01428           //   atom->probes.push_back(probe);
01429           lastPmDropped = false;
01430         }
01431       } // probe
01432       atom->probes.resize(locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex);
01433       for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx + atomProbeIndex < locProbeIndex; pIx++) {
01434         atom->probes[pIx] = &(*locProbes)[pIx + atomProbeIndex];
01435       }
01436     } // atom
01437     psConst.atoms.reserve(locAtomIndex);
01438     for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtomIndex; aIx++) {
01439       if ((*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.size() > 0) {
01440         psConst.atoms.push_back(&(*locAtoms)[aIx]);
01441       }
01442     }
01443     psConst.numGroups = 1; // pgf files only used for expression probesets.
01444     psConst.atomsPerGroup.resize(1);
01445     psConst.atomsPerGroup[0] = psConst.atoms.size();
01446     // if we excluded all the PM probes don't include this probeset.
01447     // we have some mm-only probesets in pgf lib files hence the check
01448     // that the probeset had some pm probes to start with.
01449     if (pmProbeCount == 0 && pmProbePossible > 0)
01450       keepProbeSet = false;
01451 
01452     int probeCount = psConst.countProbes();
01453 
01454     m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probeCount);
01455     // Add to chip level pm, mm, gc counts.
01456     int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(psConst.numGroups, probeCount, strlen(psConst.name));
01457     trackGlobalStats(psConst, numBytes);
01458 
01459     //std::cout << "Probeset: " << psConst << '\n';
01460 
01461     if (keepProbeSet) {
01462       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
01463         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); pIx++) {
01464           m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes[pIx]->id);
01465         }
01466       }
01467     }
01468 
01469     // Keep it around for processing?
01470     if (psConst.atoms.empty()) {
01471       Verbose::warn(1, "Empty atoms vector for probeset '" + ToStr(psConst.name) +
01472                     "', probeset name '" + psConst.name + "'");
01473     } else {
01474       if (m_SpfFile.is_open() && keepProbeSet) {
01475         writeSpfProbeSetRecord(m_SpfFile, psConst);
01476       }
01477       else if (keepProbeSet && !justStats) {
01478         // ProbeListPacked pList = plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
01479         // plVec.push_back(pList); // store the pointer
01480         plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
01481       }
01482 
01483       // Keep track of ps type
01484       // m_PsTypes.push_back((char)psConst.psType);
01485 
01486       if (probesetNames != NULL) {
01487         probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(psConst.name));
01488       }
01489           if (probesetDisplayNames != NULL) {
01490             probesetDisplayNames->push_back((pgf.probeset_name.empty() == false ? Util::cloneString(pgf.probeset_name.c_str()) : NULL));
01491           }
01492     }
01493 
01494     clearProbeSet(psConst);
01495   } // probeset
01496   if (expectedProbesets > 0) {
01497     Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
01498     if (expectedProbesets > 0 && (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets)) {
01499       Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets,  got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
01500     }
01501   }
01502   delete locProbes;
01503   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtoms->size(); aIx++) {
01504     (*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.clear();
01505   }
01506   delete locAtoms;
01507   psConst.atomsPerGroup.clear();
01508   psConst.atoms.clear();
01509 }
01510 
01511 /**
01512  * Open a file and parse the probe sets.
01513  * @param fileName - Name of file to be opened.
01514  * @param probeSetsToLoad - Which probe sets should be loaded?
01515  * @param probeSubset - Subset of probes to be loaded.
01516  * @param chipType - What sort of chip should this cdf file be for?
01517  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
01518  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
01519  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
01520  * be included and in order.
01521  * @param - killList map of probes that are to be excluded from
01522  * the probesets. A probe must have its id mapped to the probeset name
01523  * for this to work.
01524  * @param justStats - just read and generate stats, don't load into memory.
01525  * @param psTypesToLoad - What types of probesets to load into memory.
01526  * @return bool - true if success. Errors out on problems.
01527  */
01528 bool ChipLayout::openCdf(const std::string& fileName,
01529                          const std::set<const char *, 
01530                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
01531                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01532                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubset,
01533                          const std::string &chipType,
01534                          probeidmap_t &killList,
01535                          bool justStats,
01536                          std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad) {
01537   FusionCDFData *cdf = new FusionCDFData();
01538   FusionCDFData *cdfFileHeader = new FusionCDFData();
01539   //m_HaveNames = true;
01540 
01541   std::string cdf_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(fileName);
01542   cdfFileHeader->SetFileName(cdf_unc_name.c_str());
01543 
01544   if (!killList.empty())
01545     m_haveKillList = true;
01546 
01547   if (!(cdfFileHeader->Exists())) {
01548     delete cdf;
01549     delete cdfFileHeader;
01550     Err::errAbort("Can't open CDF file " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name) + " to read.");
01551   }
01552   if (!cdfFileHeader->ReadHeader()) { // All comes in with one big gulp...
01553     string msg = "Error opening CDF file to read header "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name)
01554       +": " + cdf->GetError();
01555     delete cdf;
01556     delete cdfFileHeader;
01557     Err::errAbort(msg);
01558   }
01559   if (chipType != "") {
01560     vector<std::string> chipTypes = cdfFileHeader->GetChipTypes();
01561     bool match = false;
01562     for (int i = 0; i < chipTypes.size(); i++)
01563       if (chipTypes[i] == chipType) {
01564         match = 1;
01565         break;
01566       }
01567     if (!match) {
01568       string msg = "Cdf file: " + fileName + " is of type " + chipTypes[0] + " but chip type: " +
01569         chipType + " was requested.";
01570       delete cdf;
01571       delete cdfFileHeader;
01572       Err::errAbort(msg);
01573     }
01574   }
01575 
01576   // 
01577   m_Header["chip_type"].push_back(cdfFileHeader->GetChipType());
01578   m_Header["lib_set_name"].push_back(cdfFileHeader->GetFileName());
01579   m_Header["lib_set_version"].push_back( cdfFileHeader->GetFileName());
01580   m_Header["cdf-guid"].push_back( cdfFileHeader->GetGUID() );
01581 
01582   FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdfFileHeader->GetHeader();
01583   /* there is nothing here...*/
01584   Verbose::out(2, "There are: " + ToStr(cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets()) + " probesets.");
01585   string numProbesets = ToStr(cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets());
01586   m_Header["cdf_total_probesets"].push_back(numProbesets);
01587   setDimensions(cdfHeader.GetCols(), cdfHeader.GetRows());
01588   if (probeSubset.empty()) {
01589     probeSubset.resize(cdfHeader.GetCols() * cdfHeader.GetRows(), false);
01590   }
01591   cdfFileHeader->Close();
01592   delete cdfFileHeader;
01593   
01594   if (m_SpfFileName != "") {
01595     openSpfForWrite(m_SpfFile,m_SpfFileName);
01596   }
01597 
01598   cdf->SetFileName(cdf_unc_name.c_str());
01599   if (!cdf->Read()) { // All comes in with one big gulp...
01600     string msg = "Error opening CDF file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(cdf_unc_name)+": " + cdf->GetError();
01601     delete cdf;
01602     Err::errAbort(msg);
01603   }
01604 
01605   /* Convert cdf to probe sets. */
01606   readProbeListCdfFileKillList( *cdf, 
01607                                 m_PlFactory, 
01608                                 probeSetsToLoad,
01609                                 probesetNames, 
01610                                 probeSubset, 
01611                                 killList, 
01612                                 justStats,
01613                                 psTypesToLoad);
01614   /* Make our lookup maps. */
01615   if (!justStats) {
01616     makePsMaps();
01617   }
01618   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(getProbeSetCount()) + " probe sets.");
01619   if (m_SpfFile.is_open())
01620     m_SpfFile.close();
01621 
01622   delete cdf;
01623   return true;
01624 }
01625 
01626 /**
01627  * Write out the contents of probe sets in PGF format.
01628  * @param fileName - File to write data to.
01629  * @param vec - Vector of probe sets to be stored.
01630  */
01631 void ChipLayout::writePgfFile(const std::string& fileName, 
01632                               const std::vector<ProbeSet *> &vec) {
01633   affx::PgfFile pgf;
01634 
01635   pgf.defineFilePgf();
01636 
01637   pgf.write(fileName);
01638   writePgfFile(pgf,vec);
01639   pgf.close();
01640 }
01641 
01642 /**
01643  * Write the vector of probesets to a PGF file
01644  * @param pgf - Pgf to write to
01645  * @param vec -
01646  */
01647 /// @todo shouldnt this be called "writePgfProbeSetVector"?
01648 void ChipLayout::writePgfFile(affx::PgfFile& pgf, 
01649                               const std::vector<ProbeSet *> &vec) {
01650 
01651   ProbeSet* probeset;
01652   Atom*     atom;
01653   Probe*    probe;
01654 
01655   for (unsigned int probeset_i = 0;probeset_i < vec.size(); probeset_i++) {
01656     probeset=vec[probeset_i];
01657     // write a probeset
01658     pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_id"  ,ToStr(probeset->name));
01659     ///@todo type here is not right - should not be probeset ID
01660     //pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"type"  ,(int)probeset->id);
01661     //pgf.m_tsv.set(0,"probeset_name",probeset->name);
01662     pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(0);
01663 
01664     for (unsigned int atom_i = 0;atom_i < probeset->atoms.size(); atom_i++) {
01665       atom=probeset->atoms[atom_i];
01666       // write an atom
01667       pgf.m_tsv.set(1,"atom_id",(int)atom->id);
01668       pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(1);
01669 
01670       for (unsigned int probe_i = 0;probe_i < atom->probes.size(); probe_i++) {
01671         probe=atom->probes[probe_i];
01672         // write a probe
01673         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_id"              ,(int)probe->id);
01674         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"type"                  ,Probe::stringForType((Probe::ProbeType)probe->type));
01675         pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"gc_count"              ,(int)probe->gcCount);
01676         /// @todo  these were not defined in ProbeSet.h so we cant write them out.
01677         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_length"          ,25);
01678         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"interrogation_position",13);
01679         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"probe_sequence"        ,"ACAACGACCGTTCCGGAATCGACAT");
01680         //pgf.m_tsv.set(2,"exon_position"         ,1703);
01681         pgf.m_tsv.writeLevel(2);
01682       }
01683     }
01684   }
01685 }
01686 
01687 /**
01688  * Turn the x and y cordinates of a probe on the array into an index. Should
01689  * be exactly the same index as provided by cel files.
01690  *
01691  * @param x - x coordinate on array.
01692  * @param y - y coordinate on array.
01693  * @return - index (id) of feature in cel file and other arrays.
01694  */
01695 int ChipLayout::xyToIndex(int x, int y) {
01696   return FusionCELData::XYToIndex(x,y,m_YCount,m_XCount);
01697 }
01698 
01699 
01700 /**
01701  * Convert from numeric representation to string.
01702  * @param type - numeric representation.
01703  */
01704 const char *ChipLayout::typeFromCdfType(unsigned short type) {
01705   switch(type) {
01706   case affxcdf::UnknownProbeSetType :
01707     return "unknown";
01708   case affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType :
01709     return "expression";
01710   case affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType :
01711     return "genotype";
01712   case affxcdf::ResequencingProbeSetType :
01713     return "reseq";
01714   case affxcdf::TagProbeSetType :
01715     return "tag";
01716   case affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType :
01717     return "copynumber";
01718   default :
01719     Err::errAbort("Don't recognize probe set type: " + ToStr(type));
01720   }
01721   return NULL;
01722 }
01723 
01724 /**
01725  * Is this probe a perfect match probe?
01726  * @param cel - probe information from cdf.
01727  * @return true if probe is a perfect match, false otherwise.
01728  */
01729 bool ChipLayout::isPm(const FusionCDFProbeInformation &cel) {
01730   char pBase = 'x', tBase = 'x';
01731   pBase = tolower(cel.GetPBase());
01732   tBase = tolower(cel.GetTBase());
01733   if ((pBase == 'a' && tBase == 't') ||
01734      (pBase == 't' && tBase == 'a') ||
01735      (pBase == 'c' && tBase == 'g') ||
01736      (pBase == 'g' && tBase == 'c')) {
01737     return true;
01738   }
01739   return false;
01740 }
01741 
01742 /**
01743  * Check to see if a charater is a valid DNA base of 'a','t','g', or 'c'
01744  * @param c - base to check.
01745  * @return - return true if c is in 'atgcATGC', false otherwise.
01746  */
01747 bool ChipLayout::validBase(int c) {
01748   c =  tolower(c);
01749   if (c == 'a' || c == 't' || c == 'g' || c == 'c')
01750     return true;
01751   return false;
01752 }
01753 
01754 /**
01755  * Read cdf probe information into a Probe object.
01756  *
01757  * @param p - probe object to be filled in.
01758  * @param parent - Atom that is parent of this probe.
01759  * @param numCol - column on chip.
01760  * @param numRow - row on chip.
01761  * @param direction - target direction.
01762  * @param group - group information from cdf.
01763  * @param cel -probe information from cdf.
01764  */
01765 void ChipLayout::readCdfProbe(  Probe *p, 
01766                                 Atom *parent, 
01767                                 unsigned int numCol, 
01768                                 unsigned int numRow,
01769                                 unsigned int direction,
01770                                 const FusionCDFProbeGroupInformation &group,
01771                                 const FusionCDFProbeInformation &cel) {
01772   int x = 0, y = 0;
01773   char pBase = 'x', tBase = 'x';
01774   // Do the first probe, often mismatch.
01775   x = cel.GetX();
01776   y = cel.GetY();
01777 
01778   pBase = cel.GetPBase();
01779   tBase = cel.GetTBase();
01780   p->gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
01781   p->id = xyToIndex(x,y);
01782   /* When pBase is same as tBase it is a mismatch probe
01783      as not complementary. */
01784   /* If target is complementary to probe it is a pm probe. */
01785   if (isPm(cel)) {
01786     if (direction == affxcdf::SenseDirection)
01787       p->type = Probe::PMST;
01788     else if (direction == affxcdf::AntiSenseDirection)
01789       p->type = Probe::PMAT;
01790     else
01791       p->type = Probe::PMAT;
01792     ///@todo there should be a Probe::PM type where direction is not known
01793   }
01794   /* mismatches choise can be constrained by cross hybe on snps. */
01795   else if (validBase(pBase) && validBase(tBase)) {
01796     if (direction == affxcdf::SenseDirection)
01797       p->type = Probe::MMST;
01798     else if (direction == affxcdf::AntiSenseDirection)
01799       p->type = Probe::MMAT;
01800     else
01801       p->type = Probe::MMAT;
01802     ///@todo there should be a Probe::PM type where direction is not known
01803   }
01804   else {
01805     Verbose::out(1, "Don't recognize probe type with tbase: '" + ToStr(tBase) + "'"
01806                  " and pbase: '" + ToStr(pBase) + "' at x,y: " + ToStr(x) + "," + ToStr(y));
01807   }
01808 
01809 }
01810 
01811 /**
01812  * Is a particular probe in the kill list (i.e. not to be used?)
01813  * @param probeIx - Id of probe.
01814  * @param psName - Name of probeset that contains probe.
01815  * @param killList - Map of probes not to be used.
01816  * @return true if probe id is in kill list, false otherwise.
01817  */
01818 bool ChipLayout::inKillList(probeid_t probeId, 
01819                             const std::string& psName, 
01820                             probeidmap_t &killList) {
01821   /* simplest case. */
01822   if (killList.empty())
01823     return false;
01824   /* see if this probe is in the kill list. */
01825   probeidmap_t::iterator iter;
01826   iter = killList.find(probeId);
01827   if (iter == killList.end())
01828     return false;
01829   /* check probeset */
01830   std::vector<std::string>::iterator psIter = find(killList[probeId].begin(),killList[probeId].end(),psName);
01831   if (psIter == killList[probeId].end())
01832     return false;
01833   return true;
01834 }
01835 
01836 
01837 
01838 
01839 /**
01840  * Read a vector of ProbeSets from a cdf file representation.
01841  *
01842  * @param cdf - cdf file object with probe set information.
01843  * @param psVec - vector to put newly created probe sets in.
01844  * @param probeSetsToLoad - which probe sets should be converted.
01845  * @param probeSubSet - which individual probes were loaded.
01846  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
01847  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
01848  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
01849  * be included and in order.
01850  * @param killList - map of probes ids that shouldn't be used. Map should
01851  * be of probe ids to probeset names. If a probe is in the map it will
01852  * be excluded as well as matching MM probe (or PM if probe is MM). We check
01853  * to make sure that the string that the user is mapping the probe to the same
01854  * probeset as the cdf does.
01855  */
01856 
01857 #define READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG "ERROR: readCdfProbeSet(): "
01858 
01859 /// @brief     
01860 /// @param     name      
01861 /// @param     set       
01862 /// @param     psIx      
01863 /// @param     numCol    
01864 /// @param     numRow    
01865 /// @param     probeSubSet
01866 /// @param     keepProbeSet
01867 /// @param     killList  
01868 /// @param     ps        
01869 /// @param     psNameSize
01870 /// @param     locAtoms  
01871 /// @param     locProbes 
01872 /// @param     errorCount   Count of errors so far.
01873 void ChipLayout::readCdfProbeSet(const std::string& name,
01874                                  FusionCDFProbeSetInformation &set,
01875                                  unsigned int psIx, 
01876                                  int numCol, int numRow,
01877                                  std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet, 
01878                                  bool &keepProbeSet,
01879                                  probeidmap_t &killList,
01880                                  ProbeSet &ps, 
01881                                  int &psNameSize, 
01882                                  std::vector<Atom> **locAtoms,
01883                                  std::vector<Probe> **locProbes,
01884                                  int& errorCount)
01885 {
01886   // *Warning* This function has evolved into quite a behemoth with a
01887   // series of feature requests and no time to refactor it, be
01888   // careful with modifications.
01889   FusionCDFProbeGroupInformation group;
01890   FusionCDFProbeInformation cel1, cel2;
01891   int locAtomIndex = 0, locProbeIndex = 0;
01892   clearProbeSet(ps);
01893   int name_size=name.size();
01894   if (name_size + 1 >= psNameSize) {
01895     delete [] ps.name;
01896     ps.name = new char[name_size + 1];
01897     psNameSize = name_size + 1;
01898     ps.name[psNameSize -1] = '\0'; // make sure always null terminated
01899   }
01900   strncpy(ps.name, name.c_str(), psNameSize -1);
01901   affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType set_probesettype=set.GetProbeSetType();
01902   if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType)
01903     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
01904   else if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType)
01905     ps.psType = ProbeSet::GenoType;
01906   else if (set_probesettype == affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType)
01907     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Copynumber;
01908   else if (set_probesettype==affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType)
01909     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Marker;
01910   else if (set_probesettype==affxcdf::MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType)
01911     ps.psType = ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker;
01912   else
01913     ps.psType = ProbeSet::Unknown;
01914   int numGroups = set.GetNumGroups();
01915   if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && numGroups != 2 && numGroups != 4) {
01916     // there is a bug in some cdf files where controls are marked as genotyping...
01917     Verbose::out(4, "How can probeset: " + ToStr(ps.name) + " not have 2 or 4 groups and still be genotyping?");
01918   }
01919   ps.atomsPerGroup.resize(numGroups);
01920   int totalAtoms = 0;
01921   for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) {
01922     set.GetGroupInformation(groupIx, group);
01923     totalAtoms += group.GetNumLists();
01924   }
01925   if (locAtomIndex + totalAtoms >= (*locAtoms)->size()) {
01926     Verbose::out(2, "Resizing atom size from: " + ToStr((*locAtoms)->size()) +
01927                  " to " + ToStr((*locAtoms)->size() + totalAtoms + MAX_ATOMS));
01928     resizeAtoms(locAtoms, (*locAtoms)->size() + totalAtoms + MAX_ATOMS, &ps);
01929   }
01930   ps.atoms.reserve(totalAtoms);
01931   // For each group (block?) read all the atoms. 
01932   for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) {
01933     bool expectingMisMatches = false;
01934     set.GetGroupInformation(groupIx, group);
01935     unsigned short direction = group.GetDirection();
01936     int numAtoms = group.GetNumLists();
01937     int goodAtoms = 0;
01938 
01939     // Have to be two probes per list (atom) to have a pm & mm probe.
01940     // Don't trust the GetNumCellsPerList() function, sometimes lies...
01941     if (set.GetNumLists() != 0 &&
01942        set.GetNumCells() / set.GetNumLists() == 2)
01943       expectingMisMatches = true;
01944     // Read in each atom.
01945     int cellCount = 0; // Keep track of how many cells from this group we've seen already.
01946     for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < numAtoms; atomIx++) {
01947       //
01948       Atom *a = &(**locAtoms)[locAtomIndex++];
01949       a->id = atomIx;
01950 
01951       if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::Marker) {
01952         a->allele_code=group.GetAlleleCode();
01953         a->context_code=group.GetWobbleSituation();
01954       }
01955       else if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType) {
01956         if ( groupIx % 2 == 0)
01957           a->allele_code=0;
01958         else
01959           a->allele_code=1;
01960       } 
01961       else if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker) {
01962         a->allele_code=group.GetAlleleCode();
01963         a->context_code=group.GetWobbleSituation();
01964         a->channel_code=group.GetChannel();
01965         m_numChannels = max(m_numChannels, a->channel_code+1);
01966  affxcdf::ReplicationType set_rep_type = group.GetRepType();
01967  if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::UnknownRepType) {
01968    a->replication_type=Atom::UnknownRepType;
01969  }
01970  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::DifferentRepType) {
01971    a->replication_type=Atom::DifferentRepType;
01972  }
01973  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::MixedRepType) {
01974    a->replication_type=Atom::MixedRepType;
01975  }
01976  else if (set_rep_type == affxcdf::IdenticalRepType) {
01977    a->replication_type=Atom::IdenticalRepType;
01978  }
01979  else {
01980    Err::errAbort("In ChipLayout::readCdfProbeSet: unknown Atom::ReplicationType: " + ToStr(set_rep_type));
01981  }
01982       }
01983       int numCells = group.GetNumCells();
01984       int probesPerAtom = numCells / numAtoms;
01985 
01986       if (numCells % numAtoms != 0) {
01987         Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
01988                      "Don't support atoms with varying number of probes.\n"
01989                      "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)+"\n"
01990                      "name='"+ToStr(name)+"'\n"
01991                      "numCells="+ToStr(numCells)+"\n"
01992                      "numAtoms="+ToStr(numAtoms)+"\n"
01993                      );
01994         // add to the count and punt
01995         errorCount++;
01996         return;
01997       }
01998 
01999       if (locProbeIndex + numCells >= (*locProbes)->size()) {
02000         Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm/mm size from: " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size()) + " to " +
02001                      ToStr((*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES));
02002         resizeProbes(locProbes, (*locProbes)->size() + numCells + MAX_PROBES, *locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
02003       }
02004 
02005       int atomProbeIndex = locProbeIndex;
02006       for (int cellIx = 0; cellIx < probesPerAtom; cellIx++) {
02007         if (expectingMisMatches) {
02008 
02009           // Allocate pm & mm probes
02010           Probe *pm = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02011           Probe *mm = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02012           // Look up two possibilities.
02013           group.GetCell(cellCount+cellIx, cel1);
02014           group.GetCell(cellCount+cellIx+1, cel2);
02015           cellCount += 2;
02016 
02017           // Sanity check.
02018           if (cel1.GetListIndex() != cel2.GetListIndex()) {
02019             Verbose::out(1,"ERROR: readCdfProbeSet(): "
02020                          "Expecting pm & mm probes to have same list index in cdf.\n"
02021                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "
02022                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02023                          );
02024 
02025             //
02026             errorCount++;
02027             return;
02028           }
02029    // @todo? check atom rep_type before trying to read mm?
02030           // make sure we read pm/mm correctly or die trying...
02031           if (ChipLayout::isPm(cel1)) {
02032             readCdfProbe(pm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02033             readCdfProbe(mm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel2);
02034           }
02035           else if (ChipLayout::isPm(cel2)) {
02036             readCdfProbe(pm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel2);
02037             readCdfProbe(mm, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02038           }
02039           else {
02040             Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
02041                          "Expecting a mismatch probe. "
02042                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "+
02043                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02044                          );
02045             //
02046             errorCount++;
02047             return;
02048           }
02049           /* if either of the probes are on the kill list the get tossed like never
02050              existed. */
02051           // @todo inKillList should have zero-based indexes stored.
02052           bool pmInKillList = inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(pm->id), ps.name, killList);
02053           if (pmInKillList) {
02054             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(pm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + " due to kill list");
02055             // as the mm probe is behind the pm probe have to put the mm probe in the pm probes place.
02056             *pm = *mm;
02057             clearProbe(*mm);
02058             mm = pm;
02059             pm = NULL;
02060             locProbeIndex--;
02061           }
02062           if (inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id), ps.name, killList)) {
02063             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + 
02064                          " due to kill list");
02065             clearProbe(*mm);
02066             locProbeIndex--;
02067             mm = NULL;
02068           } else if (pmInKillList) {
02069             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring MM probe " + ToStr(FROM_ZEROBASED(mm->id)) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) +
02070                          " due to PM in kill list");
02071             clearProbe(*mm);
02072             locProbeIndex--;
02073             mm = NULL;
02074           }
02075 
02076           // If these probes are to be kept, then make sure we keep the probeset
02077           if (!probeSubSet.empty() && ((pm != NULL && probeSubSet[pm->id]) || (mm != NULL && probeSubSet[mm->id])))
02078             keepProbeSet = true;
02079           // If we got order of pm & mm probes right put them in atoms.
02080           if ((pm == NULL || pm->type == Probe::PMST || pm->type == Probe::PMAT) &&
02081              (mm == NULL || mm->type == Probe::MMST || mm->type == Probe::MMAT)) {
02082             if (pm != NULL) {
02083               m_PmProbes[pm->id] = true;
02084               //              a->probes[cellIx] = pm;
02085             }
02086             if (mm != NULL && !m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02087               m_MmProbes[mm->id] = true;
02088               //              a->probes[cellIx] = mm;
02089             }
02090           }
02091           // Yikes, what did we get? Aborting...
02092           else {
02093             Verbose::out(1,READCDFPROBESET_ERR_MSG
02094                          "Expected to get a pm and mm probe pair in cdf file, but didn't."
02095                          "probeset '"+ToStr(ps.name)+"' "+
02096                          "psIx="+ToStr(psIx)
02097                          );
02098             //
02099             errorCount++;
02100             return;
02101           }
02102           // Increment cellIx by +1 as we read in two probes.
02103           cellIx++;
02104         }
02105         else {
02106           if (cellCount >= numCells) {
02107             Verbose::out(1, "WARNING: This probe set appears to be malformed in the CDF:\t" + name + 
02108                          "\tAtomCount:" + ToStr(numAtoms) + "\tCellCount:" + ToStr(cellCount) +
02109                          "\tProbesPerAtom:" + ToStr(probesPerAtom)); Err::errAbort("Test");
02110             continue;
02111           }
02112           // Just read a singleton.
02113           if (locProbeIndex + 1 >= (*locProbes)->size()) {
02114             Verbose::out(2, "Resizing probe pm only size from: " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size()) +
02115                          " to " + ToStr((*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES));
02116             resizeProbes(locProbes, (*locProbes)->size() + MAX_PROBES, *locAtoms, locAtomIndex);
02117           }
02118           Probe *p = &(**locProbes)[locProbeIndex++];
02119           //          p->parentAtom = a;
02120           group.GetCell(cellCount, cel1);
02121           cellCount++;
02122           readCdfProbe(p, a, numCol, numRow, direction, group, cel1);
02123           // If user has chosen to exclude this probe from probeset don't add it.
02124           if (inKillList(FROM_ZEROBASED(p->id), ps.name, killList)) {
02125             Verbose::out(4,"Ignoring probe " + ToStr(p->id+1) + " in probeset " + ToStr(ps.name) + " due to kill list");
02126             clearProbe(*p);
02127             locProbeIndex--;
02128           }
02129           else {
02130             // If this probes is to be kept, then make sure we keep the probeset
02131             if (!probeSubSet.empty() && probeSubSet[p->id])
02132               keepProbeSet = true;
02133             if (p->type == Probe::PMST || p->type == Probe::PMAT) {
02134               m_PmProbes[p->id] = true;
02135             }
02136             else if ((p->type == Probe::MMAT || p->type == Probe::MMST) && !(m_MmProbes.empty())) {
02137               m_MmProbes[p->id] = true;
02138             }
02139           }
02140         }
02141         a->probes.resize(locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex);
02142         for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < locProbeIndex - atomProbeIndex; pIx++) {
02143           a->probes[pIx] = &(**locProbes)[pIx + atomProbeIndex];
02144         }
02145       }
02146       //      a->parentPSet = &ps;
02147       if (a->probes.size() > 0) {
02148         ps.atoms.push_back(a);
02149         goodAtoms++;
02150       }
02151     } // end for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < numAtoms; atomIx++) 
02152     ps.numGroups++;
02153     ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx] = numAtoms;
02154     if (numAtoms != goodAtoms) {
02155       ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx] = goodAtoms;
02156     }
02157   } // end for (int groupIx = 0; groupIx < numGroups; groupIx++) 
02158 }
02159 
02160 /**
02161  * Read a vector of ProbeSets from a cdf file representation.
02162  *
02163  * @param cdf - cdf file object with probe set information.
02164  * @param psVec - vector to put newly created probe sets in.
02165  * @param probeSetsToLoad - which probe sets should be converted.
02166  * @param probeSubSet - which individual probes were loaded.
02167  * @param probesetNames - If not null filled in with the
02168  * probesetname for each probeset even if not actually into
02169  * chiplayout. Useful for chp files where every single probeset must
02170  * be included and in order.
02171  * @param killList - map of probes ids that shouldn't be used.
02172  * @param justStats - just read and generate stats, don't load into memory.
02173  * @param psTypesToLoad - What types of probesets to load into memory.
02174  */
02175 void 
02176 ChipLayout::readProbeListCdfFileKillList(FusionCDFData &cdf,
02177                                          ProbeListFactory &plFactory,
02178                                          const std::set<const char *, 
02179                                          Util::ltstr> &probeSetsToLoad,
02180                                          std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
02181                                          std::vector<bool> &probeSubSet,
02182                                          probeidmap_t &killList,
02183                                          bool justStats,
02184                                          std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> &psTypesToLoad)
02185 {
02186   int numCol = 0, numRow = 0;
02187   bool keepProbeSet = false;
02188   FusionCDFProbeSetInformation set;
02189   FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdf.GetHeader();
02190   numCol = cdfHeader.GetCols();
02191   numRow = cdfHeader.GetRows();
02192   uint32_t numProbes = numCol * numRow;
02193   resizeStats(numProbes);
02194   assert(probeSubSet.size() == 0 || probeSubSet.size() == numProbes);
02195   int expectedProbesets = cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets();
02196   //m_PsTypes.reserve(expectedProbesets);
02197 
02198   // Set up some local static storage. Once a probeset is determined
02199   // to be kept we will allocate memory on the heap for it. Trying to
02200   // prevent lots of new and deletes as they can fragement memory.
02201   ProbeSet psConst;
02202   int psConstMaxName = 256;
02203   psConst.name = new char[psConstMaxName];
02204   psConst.name[psConstMaxName -1] = '\0'; // null terminate.
02205   vector<Atom> *locAtoms = new vector<Atom>(MAX_ATOMS);
02206   vector<Probe> *locProbes = new vector<Probe>(MAX_PROBES);
02207   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr>::const_iterator emptyIter = probeSetsToLoad.end();
02208   /* Loop through probesets, reading in each one. */
02209   unsigned int dotMod = max(expectedProbesets/40,1);
02210   Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Reading " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets", 40, dotMod, expectedProbesets);
02211   unsigned int seenProbesets = 0, keptProbesets = 0;
02212 
02213   int errorCount=0; // the count of errors from readCdfProbeSet
02214 
02215   for (int psIx = 0; psIx < expectedProbesets; psIx++) {
02216     Verbose::progressStep(1);
02217     seenProbesets++;
02218     keepProbeSet = false;
02219     cdf.GetProbeSetInformation(psIx, set);
02220     // If we're not loading this type of probeset ignore it totally...
02221     if (!psTypesToLoad.empty() && 
02222         psTypesToLoad.find(set.GetProbeSetType()) == psTypesToLoad.end()) {
02223       continue;
02224     }
02225     enum affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType type = set.GetProbeSetType();
02226     if (type != affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType &&
02227         type != affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType &&
02228         type != affxcdf::CopyNumberProbeSetType &&
02229         type != affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType     &&
02230  type != affxcdf::MultichannelMarkerProbeSetType &&
02231         type != affxcdf::UnknownProbeSetType) {
02232       Verbose::out(1,"Only know how to parse expression, genotyping, copynumber, marker, multichannel and unknown probesets. "
02233                    "Got type: " + ToStr(type) + " for probeset: " + ToStr(cdf.GetProbeSetName(psIx)) + ". "
02234                    "Treating as unknown.");
02235     }
02236     readCdfProbeSet(cdf.GetProbeSetName(psIx), 
02237       set, 
02238       psIx,
02239       numCol, 
02240       numRow,
02241       probeSubSet, 
02242       keepProbeSet, 
02243       killList,
02244       psConst, 
02245       psConstMaxName, 
02246       &locAtoms, 
02247       &locProbes,
02248       errorCount);
02249 
02250     if (probesetNames != NULL) {
02251       probesetNames->push_back(Util::cloneString(psConst.name));
02252     }
02253 
02254     /* Remember the type in case this probeset isn't actually
02255        loaded. Convert type to expression if a "false" genotype
02256        probeset. */
02257     /*
02258     //This is now done in ChipLayout::getprobesettype
02259     if (psConst.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && psConst.numGroups != 2 && psConst.numGroups != 4) {
02260     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)ProbeSet::Expression);
02261     }
02262     else {
02263     m_PsTypes.push_back((char)psConst.psType);
02264     }
02265     */
02266 
02267     /* If this probe set is to be loaded do so otherwise free up memory. */
02268     keepProbeSet = true;
02269     if (!probeSetsToLoad.empty() && 
02270         probeSetsToLoad.find(psConst.name) == emptyIter)
02271       keepProbeSet = false;
02272 
02273     /* If all the probes in this probeset were on the kill list don't include it. */
02274     int probeCount = psConst.countProbes();
02275     if (probeCount == 0) {
02276       keepProbeSet = false;
02277     }
02278     /// @todo if we arent keeping the probeset which has an error, then maybe we should ignore the error
02279     ///       on that probeset and not abort.
02280 
02281     m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probeCount);
02282     int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(psConst.numGroups, 
02283                                               probeCount, 
02284                                               strlen(psConst.name));
02285     trackGlobalStats(psConst, numBytes);
02286 
02287     if (keepProbeSet) {
02288       keptProbesets++;
02289       for (int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02290         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02291           m_ProbeLayoutOrder.push_back(psConst.atoms[aIx]->probes[pIx]->id);
02292         }
02293       }
02294 
02295       if (m_SpfFile.is_open()) {
02296         writeSpfProbeSetRecord(m_SpfFile, psConst);
02297       }
02298       else if (!justStats) {
02299         for (unsigned int aIx = 0; aIx < psConst.atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02300           Atom &a = *(psConst.atoms[aIx]);
02301           for (unsigned int probeIx = 0; probeIx < a.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02302             Probe &p = *(a.probes[probeIx]);
02303             probeSubSet[p.id] = true;
02304           }
02305         }
02306         /* If somebody has specified all the probes on the kill list we
02307            can have a situation with no probes... */
02308         //ProbeListPacked pList = plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
02309         //plVec.push_back(pList); // store the pointer
02310         plFactory.pListFromPSet(psConst);
02311       }
02312     }
02313     clearProbeSet(psConst);
02314   }
02315 
02316   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
02317   if (expectedProbesets > 0 && (seenProbesets != expectedProbesets)) {
02318     Err::errAbort("Expecting: " + ToStr(expectedProbesets) + " probesets, got: " + ToStr(seenProbesets));
02319   }
02320   Verbose::out(1,"Kept " + ToStr(keptProbesets) + " probesets.");
02321 
02322   delete locProbes;
02323   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < locAtoms->size(); aIx++) {
02324     (*locAtoms)[aIx].probes.clear();
02325   }
02326 
02327   psConst.atoms.clear();
02328   psConst.atomsPerGroup.clear();
02329   delete locAtoms;
02330 
02331   // opps! we had one or more errors while reading the CDF file.
02332   if (errorCount!=0) {
02333     Err::errAbort("readCdfProbeSet(): "
02334                   "Encountered "+ToStr(errorCount)+" errors while reading CDF file.");
02335   }
02336 }
02337 
02338 const int ChipLayout::mmId(const int probeIx) const {
02339   if (m_PmMmVec.empty())
02340     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Appears that chip layout has not been set, no mismatch probes.");
02341   if (probeIx >= m_PmMmVec.size())
02342     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Probe id: " + ToStr(probeIx + 1) + " is off the chip.");
02343   const int mmIx = m_PmMmVec[probeIx];
02344   if (mmIx == NODATA)
02345     Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::mmId() - Probe id: " + ToStr(probeIx + 1) + " does not have an MM probe assigned.");
02346   return mmIx;
02347 }
02348 
02349 void ChipLayout::resizeAtoms(std::vector<Atom> **old, 
02350                              int32_t newSize, 
02351                              ProbeSet *ps) {
02352   assert((*old)->size() < newSize);
02353   std::vector<Atom> *larger = new std::vector<Atom>(newSize);
02354   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02355     Atom *o = &(**old)[i];
02356     Atom *n = &(*larger)[i];
02357     n->id = o->id;
02358     n->probes.resize(o->probes.size());
02359     for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < n->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02360       n->probes[pIx] = o->probes[pIx];
02361       //      n->probes[pIx]->parentAtom = n;
02362     }
02363     o->probes.clear();
02364     clearAtom(*o);
02365   }
02366   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < ps->atoms.size(); aIx++) {
02367     ps->atoms[aIx] = &(*larger)[aIx];
02368   }
02369   delete *old;
02370   *old = larger;
02371 }
02372 
02373 
02374 
02375 void ChipLayout::resizeProbes(std::vector<Probe> **old, 
02376                               int32_t newSize,
02377                               std::vector<Atom> *currentAtoms, 
02378                               uint32_t currentAtomCount) {
02379   assert(old);
02380   assert(currentAtoms);
02381   uint32_t origSize = (*old)->size();
02382   assert( origSize < newSize);
02383   std::vector<Probe> *larger = new std::vector<Probe>(newSize);
02384   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02385     Probe *o = &(**old)[i];
02386     Probe *n = &(*larger)[i];
02387     (*n) = (*o);
02388   }
02389   int currentProbeIx = 0;
02390   for (uint32_t aIx = 0; aIx < currentAtomCount; aIx++) {
02391     Atom *a = &(*currentAtoms)[aIx];
02392     for (uint32_t pIx = 0; pIx < a->probes.size(); pIx++) {
02393       Probe *o = a->probes[pIx];
02394       Probe *n = &(*larger)[currentProbeIx];
02395       if (o->id != n->id) {
02396         Err::errAbort("ChipLayout::resizeProbes() - Expecting id: " + ToStr(o->id) + " but got id " + ToStr(n->id));
02397       }
02398       a->probes[pIx] = n;
02399       currentProbeIx++;
02400     }
02401   }
02402   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < (*old)->size(); i++) {
02403     Probe *o = &(**old)[i];
02404     clearProbe(*o);
02405   }
02406   delete *old;
02407   *old = larger;
02408 }
02409 
02410 
02411 void ChipLayout::clearProbe(Probe &p) {
02412   p.id = 0;
02413   p.type = Probe::BLANK;
02414   p.gcCount = (char)NULLPROBEGC;
02415   //    p.parentAtom = NULL;
02416 }
02417 
02418 void ChipLayout::clearAtom(Atom &a) {
02419   vector<Probe *>::iterator pIx;
02420   a.id = 0;
02421   for (pIx = a.probes.begin(); pIx != a.probes.end(); ++pIx) {
02422     clearProbe(**pIx);
02423   }
02424   a.probes.resize(0);
02425 }
02426 
02427 void ChipLayout::clearProbeSet(ProbeSet &ps) {
02428   vector<Atom *>::iterator aIx;
02429   for (aIx = ps.atoms.begin(); aIx != ps.atoms.end(); ++aIx) {
02430     clearAtom(**aIx);
02431   }
02432   if (ps.name != NULL) {
02433     ps.name[0] = '\0';
02434   }
02435   ps.psType = ProbeSet::Unknown;
02436   ps.numGroups = 0;
02437   ps.atoms.resize(0);
02438 }
02439 
02440 /**
02441  * Keep track of global stats as we parse through file.
02442  *
02443  * @param name - Name of probeset
02444  * @param type - Class of probeset (as in ProbeSet::Type)
02445  * @param numBlocks - How many blocks are in the probeset.
02446  * @param numMatch - How many matches are there (1 for pm only, 2 for pm-mm)
02447  * @param probes - Vector of the probe ids/indexes in the array.
02448  */
02449 void
02450 ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats(const std::string& name,
02451                              int type,
02452                              int numBlocks,
02453                              const std::vector<int>& blockSizes,
02454                              int numMatch,
02455                              const std::vector<int>& probes,
02456                              bool multAlleles)
02457 {
02458   m_MaxNameLength = Max((int)name.length(), m_MaxNameLength);
02459   int pmStart = 0, pmEnd = probes.size() / numMatch;
02460   int mmStart = probes.size() / numMatch;
02461   int numBytes = ProbeListPacked::byte_size(numBlocks, probes.size(), name.size()+1);
02462   int additionalMem = Util::round(numBytes * .15) + sizeof(ProbeList);
02463   additionalMem += (12 * sizeof(char *) + sizeof(std::pair<const char *,unsigned int>)); // for name map
02464   additionalMem += 16; // for safety
02465   m_ProbesPerProbeset.addData(probes.size());
02466   m_ProbesetMemSizes.addData(numBytes + additionalMem);
02467   m_ProbeCounts.push_back(probes.size());
02468   // make probes that are in a probeset.
02469   for (int pIx = 0; pIx < probes.size(); pIx++) {
02470     if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02471       m_ProbesetProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02472   }
02473   // mark PM probes
02474   for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02475     if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02476       m_PmProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02477   }
02478   // mark MM probes if requested.
02479   if (!m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02480     for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02481       if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe)
02482         m_MmProbes[probes[pIx]] = true;
02483     }
02484   }
02485   // if MM probes and requested PM->MM matching make it
02486   if (numMatch == 2 && !m_PmMmVec.empty()) {
02487     for (int pIx = pmStart; pIx < pmEnd; pIx++) {
02488       if (probes[pIx] != ProbeList::null_probe &&
02489          probes[pIx + mmStart] != ProbeList::null_probe) {
02490         m_PmMmVec[probes[pIx]] = probes[pIx+mmStart];
02491       }
02492     }
02493   }
02494   incrementTypes(type, numBlocks, multAlleles);
02495 }
02496 
02497 void ChipLayout::incrementTypes(int type, int numBlocks, bool multipleAlleles) {
02498   if (type == ProbeSet::Expression || 
02499       (type == ProbeSet::GenoType && numBlocks != 2 && numBlocks != 4)) {
02500     m_NumExpression++;
02501   }
02502   else if ( multipleAlleles && 
02503             (type == ProbeSet::GenoType || 
02504              type == ProbeSet::Marker ||
02505              type == ProbeSet::MultichannelMarker)) {
02506     m_NumGenotyping++;
02507   }
02508 }
02509 
02510 void ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats(ProbeSet &ps, int numBytes) {
02511   Atom *atom = NULL;
02512   Probe *p = NULL;
02513   Probe *pm = NULL, *mm = NULL;
02514   m_MaxNameLength = Max((int)strlen(ps.name), m_MaxNameLength);
02515   bool multAllele = false;
02516   if (!ps.atoms.empty()) {
02517     int first = ps.atoms[0]->allele_code;
02518     for (int i = 1; i < ps.atoms.size(); i++) {
02519       if (ps.atoms[i]->allele_code != first) {
02520         multAllele = true;
02521       }
02522     }
02523   }
02524   incrementTypes(ps.psType, ps.atomsPerGroup.size(), multAllele);
02525 
02526   // 15% more for heap, pointer to name, name and probelist itself.
02527   int additionalMem = Util::round(numBytes * .15) + sizeof(ProbeList);
02528   additionalMem += (12 * sizeof(char *) + sizeof(std::pair<const char *,unsigned int>)); // for name map
02529   additionalMem += 16; // for safety
02530 
02531   m_ProbesPerProbeset.addData(ps.countProbes());
02532   m_ProbesetMemSizes.addData(numBytes + additionalMem);
02533 
02534   //m_ProbeCounts handled by caller
02535   for (uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
02536     uint32_t probeIx = 0;
02537     atom = ps.atoms[atomIx];
02538     /* Do indivitual probe stats. */
02539     for (probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02540       p = atom->probes[probeIx];
02541       /* Store the gc count for this particular probe. */
02542       if (!m_ProbeGcVec.empty()) {
02543         if (p->id>=m_ProbeGcVec.size()) {
02544           Err::errAbort("trackGlobalStats: Internal error: id ("+ToStr(p->id)+")>=ProbeGcVec.size()");
02545         }
02546         m_ProbeGcVec[p->id] = p->gcCount;
02547       }
02548       /* Keep track of pm and mm probes. */
02549       if (p->type == Probe::PMAT || p->type == Probe::PMST) {
02550         m_PmProbes[p->id] = true;
02551       }
02552       else if ((p->type == Probe::MMAT || p->type == Probe::MMST) && 
02553                !m_MmProbes.empty()) {
02554         m_MmProbes[p->id] = true;
02555       }
02556       if (ps.psType != ProbeSet::Unknown) {
02557         m_ProbesetProbes[p->id] = true;
02558       }
02559     }
02560 
02561     /* Do the pm->mm mapping. */
02562     for (probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom->probes.size() && probeIx < atom->probes.size() - 1; probeIx++) {
02563       pm = atom->probes[probeIx];
02564       mm = atom->probes[probeIx+1];
02565       if (pm->type == Probe::PMST && mm->type == Probe::MMST && !m_PmMmVec.empty())
02566         m_PmMmVec[pm->id] = mm->id;
02567       if (pm->type == Probe::PMAT && mm->type == Probe::MMAT && !m_PmMmVec.empty())
02568         m_PmMmVec[pm->id] = mm->id;
02569     }
02570   }
02571 
02572   if (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType && !m_PmAlleleMatchVec.empty()) {
02573     int atomIndex = 0;
02574     /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
02575        type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
02576     for (int psIx = 0; psIx < ps.numGroups - 1; psIx += 2) {
02577       Err::check(ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx] == ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx+1],
02578                  "ChipLayout::trackGlobalStats() - Must have matched A and B allele probes when using this analysis. Probeset '" + ToStr(ps.name) + "' has unmatched probe count.");
02579       int atomsPer = ps.atomsPerGroup[psIx];
02580       /* Each block will have atomsPer atoms in there. */
02581       for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
02582         int aIndex = atomIx + (atomIndex);
02583         int bIndex = aIndex + atomsPer;
02584         Atom *A = ps.atoms[aIndex];
02585         Atom *B = ps.atoms[bIndex];
02586         if (A->probes.size() != B->probes.size()) {
02587           Err::errAbort("For probeset '" + ToStr(ps.name) + " A and B alleles must have same number of probes.");
02588         }
02589         for (int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
02590           m_PmAlleleMatchVec[A->probes[probeIx]->id] = B->probes[probeIx]->id;
02591           m_PmAlleleMatchVec[B->probes[probeIx]->id] = A->probes[probeIx]->id;
02592         }
02593       }
02594     }
02595   }
02596 }
02597 
02598 /**
02599  * Reads in probes to kill.
02600  *
02601  * @param fileName - file containing BadProbes
02602  * @param killList - things to kill, determined from file
02603  * @param rows - number of rows in cel file
02604  * @param cols - number of cols in cel file
02605  */
02606 void ChipLayout::fillInKillList(const std::string& fileName, 
02607                                 probeidmap_t &killList, int rows, int cols) {
02608 
02609   assert(fileName!="");
02610   assert(rows > 0);
02611   assert(cols > 0);
02612 
02613   killList.clear();
02614   affx::TsvFile tsv;
02615   int count = 0;
02616   probeidmap_t::iterator mapIter;
02617   vector<string>::iterator psIter;
02618 
02619   bool haveProbeId = false;
02620   bool haveXY = false;
02621 
02622   string psName;
02623   int probeId;
02624   int x,y;
02625 
02626   if (tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK)
02627     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
02628 
02629   if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id") == TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
02630     Err::errAbort("Probe kill list file, " + ToStr(fileName) + ", does not have probeset_id column.");
02631   else
02632     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &psName, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02633 
02634   // We expect either a probe_id column or an x/y column.
02635   if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
02636     tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02637     haveProbeId = true;
02638   }
02639   if ((tsv.cname2cidx(0, "x") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) && (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "y") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)) {
02640     tsv.bind(0, "x", &x, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02641     tsv.bind(0, "y", &y, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
02642     haveXY = true;
02643   }
02644 
02645   if (!haveProbeId && !haveXY)
02646     Err::errAbort("Kill list file must have either a probe_id column or an x and y column.");
02647 
02648   while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
02649 
02650     int probeIdFromXY = -1;
02651     if (haveXY) {
02652       int rv=affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData::XYToIndex(x,y,rows,cols);
02653       probeIdFromXY = FROM_ZEROBASED(rv);
02654     }
02655 
02656     if (haveProbeId) {
02657       if (haveXY && probeIdFromXY != probeId) {
02658         Err::errAbort("ProbeID value (" + ToStr(probeId) + ") does not match x,y (" +
02659                       ToStr(x) + "," + ToStr(y) + ") based ID (" + ToStr(probeIdFromXY) + ").");
02660       }
02661     } else if (haveXY) {
02662       probeId = probeIdFromXY;
02663     } else {
02664       Err::errAbort("In unexpected part of code. No XY or ProbeID in kill list.");
02665     }
02666 
02667     mapIter = killList.find((uint32_t)probeId);
02668     if (mapIter != killList.end()) {
02669       psIter = find(killList[(uint32_t)probeId].begin(),killList[(uint32_t)probeId].end(),psName);
02670       if (psIter != killList[(uint32_t)probeId].end()) {
02671         Err::errAbort("Probe id: " + ToStr(probeId) + " specified twice in file: " + fileName);
02672       } else {
02673         killList[(uint32_t)probeId].push_back(psName);
02674         count++;
02675       }
02676     } else {
02677       killList[(uint32_t)probeId].push_back(psName);
02678       count++;
02679     }
02680   }
02681   Verbose::out(1, "Loaded: " + ToStr(count) + " probe/probeset pairs to be ignored from: " + Fs::basename(fileName));
02682   tsv.close();
02683 }
02684 
02685 /**
02686  * @brief compare probeset names according to respective probeset ids
02687  * @param a, b - probeset names to be ordered
02688  */
02689 // static bool ChipLayout::compareProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(std::string a, std::string b) {
02690 //   return (getProbeSetIndexByName(a) < getProbeSetIndexByName(b));
02691 // }
02692 
02693 void ChipLayout::sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(std::vector<std::string>::iterator begin, std::vector<std::string>::iterator end) {
02694   if (begin < end - 1) {
02695     std::vector<std::string>::iterator right = end - 1;
02696     std::vector<std::string>::iterator left = begin;
02697     std::string temp;
02698     int pivot = getProbeSetIndexByName(*right);
02699     
02700     while (left < right) {
02701       while (left < right && getProbeSetIndexByName(*left) <= pivot) {
02702  left++;
02703       }
02704       while (left < right && pivot < getProbeSetIndexByName(*right)) {
02705  right--;
02706       }
02707       
02708       if (left < right) {
02709  temp = *left;
02710  *left = *right;
02711  *right = temp;
02712       }
02713     }
02714     
02715     sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(begin, right);
02716     sortProbesetNameByProbesetIdx(left, end);
02717   }
02718 }
